channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Universe’s first magnetic fields were shockingly weak, but changed everything
item.description: Primordial magnetic fields, billions of times weaker than a fridge magnet, may have left lasting imprints on the Universe. Researchers ran over 250,00...

item.title: NASA’s Mars rover Curiosity captures stunning details of alien rock formations
item.description: Curiosity is exploring Mars’ boxwork terrain, where ridges and hollows may have formed from cementation and erosion. The rover has been documenting ro...

item.title: Student’s pinkie-sized fossil reveals a new croc species
item.description: A 95-million-year-old crocodyliform fossil, affectionately nicknamed Elton, was discovered in Montana by student Harrison Allen. Unlike most crocs, it...

item.title: 10 people who beat 8,000 others to become NASA astronaut candidates
item.description: NASA has chosen 10 new astronaut candidates who will train for missions to the Moon and Mars. Their selection represents a powerful blend of talent an...

item.title: How dehydration secretly fuels anxiety and health problems
item.description: Not drinking enough water could intensify stress responses. Researchers found that under-hydrated individuals had cortisol levels more than 50% higher...
